questions.neutral: It's one of those nights, isn't it?

hobby.message: Origami helping you dodge the spiral?
Political literature age better than policy?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: Yeah. Feels like things outside are getting tense.
I still get out. Fly my drone after work sometimes.
Doesn’t always go as planned lately.
People move differently now.
Feels off, yeah. I usually relax by flying my FPV drone.
Spent a lot of nights in old yards nearby.
Last time, too many new faces out there.
Signal interference made it harder than usual.
I pack up fast these days.
Hobby keeps me steady—freestyle drone flying, mostly industrial dead zones.
Went out last night, tried the east trainyard.
Used to be quiet, but now people are moving supplies there.
Lost control for a bit—somebody was jamming the signal.
Almost lost the drone. Had to improvise recovery.
Never had interference that strong before.
FPV drone flying is my way to clear my head.
Always liked pushing tech, custom firmware, tight spaces.
Last night I flew at the old depot. Saw supply runners—probably those invisible citizens back, moving through gaps.
Jamming nearly brought my drone down; had to cut power and run.
Wasn’t scared but noticed people clocking my wristband.
Feels like the city blurs work and escape now.
Never worried about that before.
Freestyle FPV drones—been building and flying for years, keeps me sane.
Tweak firmware myself, so I dodge most city surveillance, or used to.
Last time out, saw invisible folks—ones who vanished from BCI—hauling supplies at the trainyard.
Signal jamming felt deliberate, like someone covering tracks or watching who’s around.
Had to land quick and recover before anyone got ideas.
Makes me think of my brother; he disappeared after a BCI audit. I keep hoping people like him are out there.
Even flying as a habit, I can’t ignore how this city is changing.
Now, hobby or not, every outing feels risky.
hobby_answer: Yeah, swapped in a new antenna. Nothing too drastic.
Flight range is a bit limited lately. Weather, maybe.
Not easy with all the city interference now.
Haven't had much time to fly… everything's changing out there.
Just keeping my head down with it for now.
Yeah, added a custom filter. Needed it after last week.
Signal ranges have been rough with all the extra interference since the outages.
Saw some new faces near the old yard. Made me cut a session short.
Not sure what groups are moving through there lately, but I steer clear.
Tough to trust the airspace with the system acting up.
Flying used to help me reset. Now it's different.
Yeah, just modded the video transmitter last night to push through all the new jamming.
Had to switch up flight plans—more people using blind spots since the BCI glitch.
Last run, my drone lost signal near a supply drop. Not normal for that area.
I think some of those 'disappeared' folks are moving gear around there lately.
Makes flying interesting, but way riskier than before.
Been making quick recoveries, just in case.
Hard to focus now with all the system issues bleeding into my off time.
Yeah, upgraded the quad with a spectrum analyzer. Needed it with all the recent RF spikes.
Now, every session feels like threading a needle. The city's noise isn't just static—it's people moving off grid.
Ran into one of the invisible groups last flight, by accident. Wasn't expecting to see them that close.
Drone lost control for a minute—way too much interference. Had to cut power and chase it down.
Kind of ironic. My hobby's supposed to clear my head, not add stress.
Feels like my own skillset's being tested in ways I never planned for.
Makes me think the line between work and play's definitely gone.
Sometimes I wonder who’s watching who now.
Yeah, built a new failsafe protocol after last week's scare. Needed something quick—too many unknowns.
Used to map out empty spots for flying, but now they're never really empty. Supply teams, vanished citizens... all crossing into my routes.
Saw faces I remember from old ticket logs—not just rumors anymore. Some recognized my quad, I think.
Almost got my setup bricked by a jamming burst. Had to hard-recover, hands shaking.
I started out flying to get away from BCI surveillance, but now avoiding people’s more complicated.
Funny, I help keep those bands working at work, but I see what slipping through means out there.
Feels like both sides—system and the invisibles—are adapting. So am I.
Flying’s gotten tense, but it’s still mine. Just not what it used to be.
Reminds me how close everything’s connected now, even the escapes.
